intro: Guajava gardneriana, commonly known as the wild guanabana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces a fragrant, white flower that blooms in clusters. Its fruit, similar to the guanabana, is typically green when unripe and turns yellow or red when mature. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
